mdRecord.dcterms:title: Hoover Dam Dedication Monument, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Hansen, Oskar J. W. F. (Norwegian-American sculptor, 1892-1971) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Monument and and flagpole, showing winged figures

Hansen's principal work at Hoover Dam is the monument of dedication on the Nevada side of the dam. Here, rising from a black, polished base, is a 142-foot flagpole flanked by two winged figures, which Hansen calls the Winged Figures of the Republic. ... The winged figures are 30 feet high. Their shells are 5/8-inch thick, and contain more than 4 tons of statuary bronze. ... The figures rest on a base of black diorite, an igneous rock. ... Surrounding the base is a terrazzo floor, inlaid with a star chart, or celestial map. The chart preserves for future generations the date on which President Franklin D. Roosevelt dedicated Hoover Dam, September 30, 1935. -- https://www.usbr.gov/lc/hooverdam/History/essays/artwork.html [work]
